venice.hub

Class DiskReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • venice.hub.VeniceReader
      • venice.hub.DiskReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class DiskReader
extends VeniceReader
    Reads data from disk.

    Reads XIO lines of log file, convert them into SlotEvent objects and puts them into the TTEQueue. The actual reading from file and the parsing will be done by the TTEBufferedReader.

    Author:
    Oliver Eickmeyer
    See Also:
    TTEBufferedReader, TTEQueue

      • read

        protected venice.lib.parser.SlotEvent read()
        Reads a SlotEvent from TTEBufferedReader over SynchronousQueue.

        Will wait, if SynchronousQueue is empty, but not forever, so that events like pausing, seeking or reseting will not be missed.

        Overrides:
        read in class VeniceReader
        Returns:
        a SlotEvent read from source.

      • getFirstTimestamp

        public long getFirstTimestamp()
        Gets the timestamp of the first event in the buffer of the disk reader. If the buffer is empty, 0 is returned.
        Returns:
        timestamp of first event in buffer, or 0 if the buffer is empty

      • getThresholdTimestamp

        public long getThresholdTimestamp()
        Gets the timestamp of the item on the threshold in the buffer of the disk reader. If the buffer has less items then the threshold, the timestamp of the last event is returned instead.

        Example:
        If the capacity of the buffer is 1000 and the threshold is 100, than the timetamp of the 900th item is returned. But if the buffer holds only 700 items, then the timestamp of the 700th event is returned.

        Returns:
        timestamp of the event on the threshold, or, if the buffer size is smaller than the threshold, the timestamp of the last event

      • getLastTimestamp

        public long getLastTimestamp()
        Gets the timestamp of the last event in the buffer of the disk reader. If the buffer is empty, 0 is returned.
        Returns:
        timestamp of last event in buffer, or 0 if the buffer is empty

      • getBufferSize

        public int getBufferSize()
        Gets the size of the buffer used by the disk reader.
        Returns:
        size of buffer

      • getCAPACITY

        public int getCAPACITY()
        Gets the maximum capacity of the buffer.
        Returns:
        capacity of the buffer

      • getTHRESHOLD

        public int getTHRESHOLD()
        Gets the threshold of the buffer.
        Returns:
        threshold of the buffer

        public void seek(long timestamp)
        Seeks to a specific timestamp in the file.
